text: The Melrose and Sinkola Plantations, in Thomas County, Georgia, a property of , was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1990. The listed area included 50 contributing buildings, three contributing structures, and one contributing site. A work by architects Walker & Weeks is included. With (see photo captions pages 19-21 of text document). ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Greek Revival architecture in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Colonial Revival architecture in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Houses in Thomas County, Georgia Category:National Register of Historic Places in Thomas County, Georgia Category:Plantations in Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Melrose and Sinkola Plantations
